title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 217.2 - Provision of interpreting services in clerk's offices
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 217.2 - Provision of interpreting services in clerk's offices

State Regulations
A court clerk shall provide interpreting
services at no expense to a person with limited English proficiency seeking
assistance at the court clerk's office in accordance with the needs of the
person seeking assistance and the availability of court interpreting services. Such services may be provided by telephone or live audiovisual
means. Notes

217.2

New

York State Register June 22, 2016/Volume XXXVIII, Issue 25, eff. 6/1/2016

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
